captions.text:
- I am currently in a long
distance relationship.

- For two and a half years
it was long distance.

- The first was two years
and I am in one now.
- We've dated for two years.
Then we dated a year long distance.
Then we lived together for a year
and then we did
six months or so long distance
before it ended.
- We were long distance for a year.

What It's Like To Be In A
Long Distance Relationship
- The hardest part is feeling
that nobody else thinks
that what you're doing is sustainable.

- You don't have to
plan your day around it,

but you definitely have
to make extra effort.
- So there'd be a lot of issues
as far as communication

where I'm not willing to
Skype for three hours.

- We still call each other
- Sometimes.
- like every three days, I'd say.

- You run out of things
to say on the phone.
"How was your day?" "It was fine."
Like, "Did anything happen?"
It's like, "No, not really," like,
"It was just like a normal day."
And so then there's silence.
- What was special about my day
and how did it change me

and how can I share that
with the other person?
- Even if you're just sitting in the car
driving someplace in silence,
you're together and you feel that.
And you don't have that

when you're in a long
distance relationship

and you're trying to
artificially recreate it
but silence over the phone is,
I mean, it's nothing, right?
Silence in person means something.

- You fall in love and
it's hard and it's like,

will I connect with
someone like this again?
And is it worth it?
- When you really like someone
or even love someone,
it makes it worth it.
- You're constantly asking yourself,
"Is it worth it?"
And I feel like I learn something new
every time I ask myself that question.
- I mean, it wasn't worth it, right?
Cause we broke up. So.

- But, we were never like,
- But.
- this is ending our relationship.
- Yeah.
- It was just, this sucks,
that this is our relationship right now.
- Really when it comes down to it
any your relationship ends,

when either one person
stops caring about the other
or both people give up.

- I think the key to doing
a long distance relationship
is having an end in sight.
- Like a date, she would move in,

- Mmhmm.
- we would move in together
in July, so, we knew that.
- And then we did.

- We did.
- Woooo.
- You really learn about communication
and how to stay open with someone.
- It made us also, like,

not dwell as much on, like,
little arguments anymore,

unless you forget to bring
your girlfriend potatoes

(laughing)
from the German restaurant.
She will drill it home for an hour at you.
This happened last night.
- Waiting, you know, several days
before you can even talk
or Skype with the other person.

Or waiting months before
you can hug them again.
It's hard (giggling).
- It makes you appreciate loving someone
when you can see them everyday.

- Aaaww.
- Mmhmm.
- So sweet. (lips smacking)
- [Man] I had some--
- [Woman] I texted him twice

to ask for these potatoes
- No you texted me once.

- after work.
- about the potatoes.
- They're good potatoes.
- They're so good.
But I wouldn't know
because I didn't have them yesterday.
- Yep.

title: What It’s Like To Be In A Long Distance Relationship

comments.text:
I'm currently in a long distance relationship and the communication part 
sure is hard to work with.. Do-able, but very draining; we are two 
individuals after all and it's just so very draining. Silence over the 
phone or skype really is nothing compared to silence in person. We do have 
a goal to move in together soon and there is a date, too..it just does seem 
far away even if it isn't.﻿
comments.author: Vexivian Vivian

comments.text:
I think the absolute worst for me was that EVERYONE kept telling me how and 
why long distances don't work ... I mean, I'm already having a bad time not 
being able to see the person I love, I really don't need you telling me 
that I'm gonna break up with her. Seriously, if you know someone who's in a 
long distance, please don't rub it in their faces that such relationships 
always fail :/﻿
comments.author: Sparrow Tail

comments.text: so true missing my baby right now :( x﻿
comments.author: gemma laura

comments.text:
My boyfriend lives in Wales, while I'm currently in Maryland. I think the 
worst part about it all is that my mother and my sister think that long 
distance relationships are "stupid", that they aren't real and they never 
work out. The two years that we have spent together is pretty much hidden 
from our families because of their disapproval. It's not like it really 
matters as we are adults ourselves, but I wish I could tell them without 
them being judgmental about it. I want people to know about us.

It's hard enough being separate from someone in the same continent as you, 
but seeing as he is across the ocean it can be more difficult. We have yet 
to meet face to face because of the costs, but I think we're finally 
getting closer to meeting each other after saving up for so long. I can't 
express how refreshing that feeling is.

Being in a long distance relationships requires a lot of trust, time and 
effort. It's more challenging than any of the real relationships I have 
had. However, I have never been so happy with someone before. True love can 
accomplish anything.﻿
comments.author: Brooke

comments.text:
I think a long distance relationship is completely worth it. Yes you don't 
have that physical touch, but if you love that person truly, you won't end 
it because of the distance. Every relationship comes with hardships and 
distance is just another obstacle you gotta handle in order to reach that 
goal of happiness with your other.﻿
comments.author: NakiOhPocky

comments.text:
mine was 6 years long distance, only 1 visit for 3 weeks out of the whole 
thing...﻿
comments.author: Devils Quartz

comments.text:
I'm in a long distance relationship and have been for almost two years, I'm 
in California he lives in Virginia. (But right now he's studying abroad) we 
have two rules. Never go to sleep angry with each other and always be 
honest. It definitely has its highs and lows like any relationship but 
sometimes it can get tougher in our case but thats when you talk and work 
things out and things will get better because you both care very deeply and 
it's all worth it. For us we would see each other every couple months and 
be together for two weeks! We made those days COUNT and memorable ugh (: 
going back home felt like the world was ending so I won't go there because 
it SUCKED so so bad. Anyways I didn't mean for this to be long and annoying 
for those reading haha but just keep your heads up have faith! Communicate 
with your loved one be honest and don't go to sleep grumpy! It'll all 
hopefully work out if you just do that, why wouldn't you if you care and 
love the person so much right? And all you want to do is make them happy! :)

But P.S. We get our keys to our new Apt. July 1st in Va!!﻿
comments.author: Andres Hernandez

comments.text:
I think what sucks the most is that moment of goodbye, when you know you're 
not going to see her for a long time, and you kiss her one last time before 
getting into the train, you look out the window, wave at her, the train 
starts going and the next second you can't see her face anymore. It just 
kills me every time, I can't help but cry like a baby and everyone keeps 
staring at me but I just don't care because it feels like the end of the 
world to me. It's so horrible and there's nothing I can do about it. And 
then you sit in the train, all by yourself for hours. You have time to 
think, you have time to be sad. That just makes it worse. I mean it's 
releaving when you can cry for 5 minutes or so, but then I'd really need 
some distraction.
Everytime I'm with my gf, I'm scared of this moment, I hate it so much, 
it's the worst thing I ever felt, but she is absolutley worth the suffering 
for me. I mean, I'll feel better soon and I know I will see her again.
Does anybody understand what I' saying or does this sound like bullshit to 
you? It does to me, even though I know that's how I feel and that's how it 
is for me...﻿
comments.author: Doppelkeks7

comments.text:
The worst part IN a relationship, I think is... silance... if its long 
distance or not... but silance kills and it says more then a 1000 words.﻿
comments.author: Søs L (NotSonicDesigns)

comments.text:
I think that people who are able to keep a healthy long distance 
relationship build an even stronger relationship because you have to make 
extra efforts and you appreciate even more how lucky you are when you're 
able to physically be with your partner﻿
comments.author: Leithianel Ýrul

comments.text:
LDR for three years now, we've been engaged since January. I'm from Finland 
and she's from Florida. So so so so excited to see her again, and looking 
forward to finally being together in a few years time.﻿
comments.author: po pop

comments.text:
I've been faced with this dilemma recently. The last two weeks I've been on 
a few dates with a guy I really like, the only problem is he works overseas 
quite a lot. He is a lovely person & as much as I like him, I've decided 
not to start a relationship with him. I know for me when I start a 
relationship with someone I want it to be the real deal & I just don't 
think long distance would be like that. Dating is so difficult ... *sighs* 
:(﻿
comments.author: Sophie Loves Sparkle ItalianAussie

comments.text: HAHAHA, I'm depressed now!﻿
comments.author: RaheezieYasha

comments.text:
Okay, so I'm in a long-distance relationship and have been for... it feels 
like a lot longer than the nine months it is. We're still together of 
course... but it's been difficult. We can't call, because his brother is 
obnoxious and his sister is 8.
But we text all the time. I'm not sure exactly how, but in between talking 
about the past and planning for the future, among our other topics like 
politics, economics, religion, we find something to talk about. There's 
never a point at which I don't know what to text him. We both have a lot of 
hobbies and, if you go into sufficient detail, anything can be interesting. 
We have to save up money for bus tickets whenever we want to see each 
other. I've probably blown more money on that - on him - than I have spent 
on anything else in my life. But it's honestly the only thing I've spent 
large swaths of money on that I don't regret the tiniest bit.﻿
comments.author: Jenya Lestina

comments.text:
Yes it does suck... i was in a relationship with my girlfriend for a total 
of 6 1/2 years and the last year and a half was too much for her and ended 
up in her breaking up with me.﻿
comments.author: MRInuzaki

comments.text:
I'm in a 6 year relationship, and 4 of those years were long distance. This 
struck home.﻿
comments.author: LIGHTSisLYFE

comments.text: I cried throughout this whole thing. ﻿
comments.author: Princess Jasmine

comments.text:
I've been in a long distance relationship before, I honestly believe the 
people who have the strongest form of love are the ones who would pass up 
the guy or girl next door to rather be with the guy or girl miles away in 
another state  it shows how strong they really are as a couple﻿
comments.author: The merc with a mouth

comments.text:
Thank you buzzfeed for making something that shows the struggles of long 
distance relationships while proving it's not all bad. 
It will be almost 2 years in my long distance relationship. It's one of the 
hardest things I've ever done, everyday he is the only person I want to 
see. I'm moving to where he is in august. It's good to have an end in 
sight. Males things 10× easier﻿
comments.author: Sara O'Malley

comments.text:
Been in LDR for 3 years- we're married now and have never been so happy! :) 
Do not let the distance (and maybe other people with negative opinions) 
bring you down, you can make it! Lots of <3 for LDR couples out there, stay 
strong!﻿
comments.author: komandantData

comments.text: Distance didn't kill us, doubt did. Worst goodbye ever. Regret it all.﻿
comments.author: Rianne McRoberts

comments.text:
We've been in LDR in and out for 12 years. Is it difficult? Yes! Is it 
worth it? Absolutely! Teaches you to treasure every moment together. But 
it's not for everyone for sure, sadly. Communication is the key. And trust, 
of course. If you trust your partner, distance is nothing.﻿
comments.author: cassamell

comments.text:
Thank you buzzfeed for this video, I can't express how true all of this is. 
Especially the part with other people not believing it will work and 
telling you it won't last, it's almost the most depressing of all because 
you have to keep the faith all on your own﻿
comments.author: Karen Kvakestad

comments.text:
I'm in a long distance relationship, I'm doing my studies in France while 
my boyfriend tries to get the hell out of Algeria. Now it's been year and a 
half that I'm waiting for him, hopefully he comes in July for a mounth. 
It's hard, it hurts sometimes, this is kind of scary, but at the same time 
this is excitng and we have an awesome relationship despite the distance. I 
learn a lot from this relation, I feel like I'm "stronger" than before. 
That sounds like bullshit anyway! For those who are in the same situation, 
here some tips: 
-Never forget to say "I love you". Every single day. Since you're not able 
to kiss, to hug, having sex or anything else, this is the only way to show 
your feelings. Use it! Even if you're mad. And even when you're together! 
-Girls, not seeing your significant other does not mean you can't use 
physic seduction. I bought a nighty a few days ago and showed him on skype. 
He loved it and got turned on. We'll have epic sex when he'll come, I 
guarantee it! 
-Have a goal together, it strengthens your relation. This is kinda hard to 
be in a long distance relationship without any "target", the more you share 
together, the closer you'll be. We plan to live together. 
-You don't have anything to say about your day? Guess what, in a year and a 
half we NEVER asked each others how he's doing and how was the day. Most of 
the time, we're just talking dumbshit and do a lot of stupid things, like 
making a dress out of a trashbag or find out how you can piss the other off 
the most. Well, he's really good at it. This is like a game to us! Have 
your own games!
-I'm the party hard kind and my boyfriend is muslim, so he's the complete 
opposite. It doesn't bother him, because I always remember to send him a 
message like "hey dude, I love you! And I'm kinda turned on! Have good 
night!". Even if I'm super wasted. It takes only 1 minute (or more 
according how fucked up I am) and trust me, this means a lot!
-Talk about your habits, your way of life, your friends and family! This is 
pretty cool to know the other's environment!﻿
comments.author: Jah Queen

comments.text: It is never worth it.﻿
comments.author: cvc

comments.text:
I'm 152 miles away from my love. I would walk to meet them, even for 5 
minutes. (._.)﻿
comments.author: The Morticians Daughter (Ashleigh Hope) ♡

comments.text: That guy in the red shirt, so much wisdom and pain﻿
comments.author: Baraka Gitari

comments.text:
What, dude in red shirt? If you run out of things to talk about there is 
just no chemistry. There's tons of things in the world to discuss besides 
yourself and what you did that day﻿
comments.author: Summer Tai

comments.text:
9 months ago, my bf moved. The only thing is, he found out he was moving 
the week after I said yes when he asked me out. I miss him, and I always 
will Untill I see him, but we still text, call and talk on skype and Xbox, 
I wait till the day, when I will see him again, and just run into him arms. 
But, if your thinking of calling It off just cuz he or she is long distance 
away from you, I say, don't!! Being long distance can start a conversation, 
give you something to do, and make it waaaaay more romantic, cute, and 
happy, and heartwarming when you both see Eachother again. Now, go get your 
lover on the phone, and just, talk, it can be a lot of fun, trust me. 😉😄﻿
comments.author: Darra Kershner

comments.text:
So much truth in this video. I hate how much I relate with the guy in the 
red shirt. I know that pain all too well.﻿
comments.author: Cheyenne Kasworm

comments.text: This is how a friendship works too. ﻿
comments.author: Kayla

comments.text:
This video was more sad than happy which kind of disappoints me. Seems like 
for most of the people things didn't really work out. I've been in a long 
distance relationship for going on 9 months (had a "thing" for over a 
year). He lives in Cleveland, Ohio and I live in London, Ontario. So we're 
only about a 6 hour drive from each other but it's still hard. We're both 
in school and working part time, and while I always get weekends off, he 
always works weekends so we take time off work to see each other once a 
month or two. I constantly worry about how hard it will be when I go to 
college in January because I have 8 years of schooling and he's only in his 
second year of university and hasn't decided on his major (he's thinking of 
either animal care or gerontology) . I told him if we can tough out the 
next 3 years (I have 1 year welding techniques, 2 years diesel motive power 
then 5 years apprenticeship to become a certified automotive technician, 
but I only have my schools picked for the 3 years so far) then we can talk 
about the future more. Our end goal is to live together, but we have to 
decide which country to live in. It's a hard decision because I don't want 
to take him away from his friends and family and he feels the same towards 
me. But if it's really worth it and you love each other, you'll always 
figure a way out.﻿
comments.author: kaleywhalie

comments.text:
This video made me tear up as well... 
About 6 years ago this guy I met on World of Warcraft became interested in 
me. I was already in a relationship and the guy was very emotionally 
abusive. I was scared to tell him no when he wanted to have sex and when I 
did on the rare occasions he would yell and punch things. He eventually 
attempted to cheat on me when I eventually dumped him. All the while this 
was going on, my friend on WoW was there for me and actually helped me in 
the game. We would talk on vent and skype until he eventually asked me out 
on Christmas Eve. We dated for 2 years and then an unfortunate event 
happened between us during one of the visit that drove me to break up with 
him. 6 went on and we went back and forth with talking and not talking. It 
wasn't until this year that we seriously started to talk again. We both 
dated other people but always found ourselves yearning for the other. He 
visited me over spring break so we could see where we were at. Could we 
move on or is this an actual feeling? During that visit, it was like it 
never ended. We both refell in love with each other and now dating again. 
Although it has been rough with the distance, we are trying to plan on who 
moves where. He lives in California and I live in Texas. By the end of 6 
months we will both hopefully know.﻿
comments.author: Sadie Havok

comments.text:
My boyfriend and I have been together for almost four years now and he is 
going away to uni in September. I'm scared that he will not make an effort 
to text me, call me or even skype me, while he is away. At the moment if I 
don't see him during the day he will never text me first, he will only do 
this if I ask him to the night before. and if I text him in the morning he 
will not text me until lunch or even later because "he's busy" or "in a 
rush". I only get to see him when he is not over his dads house during the 
week and if I do see him, I only see him for twenty minutes. I go over his 
house once a week and he works weekends 10am until 7pm and he'll see me 
then for only twenty minutes because he is tired. If I talk to him about 
this we'll just have an arguement. I'm afraid that I will lose him:/﻿
comments.author: Jessie Taylor-Stewart

comments.text:
I have been in a LDR for about a year and a half now, about 3000 miles 
away. He's finally coming to visit me for a few days and take me to prom (:﻿
comments.author: Ella Walker

comments.text:
Im really really curious as to how long their long distance relationships 
are. In my case weve been together for four years, and all four years weve 
had an extremely good but difficult time. She lives in Chile, I live in 
Austria...its tough. 6 hours of time difference is something insanely 
difficult to get around, especially when one person doesnt have time and 
you are basically relegated to communicating solely through whatsapp or 
facebook just because these long distance calls (even through 
skype->house/cell phone) can be fucking expensive. 

its tough, but what I think helps a lot is if you know what youre getting 
into when the relationship starts. If you know from the get-go this is is 
how its gona be, that we wont see each other for 7+ months of the year, and 
youre both ok with it, you dont really know too much about what youre 
missing. All these couples, that start their relationships while they live 
in the same city or town, theyre used to being together, to simply go over 
to the others house/apartment, they get so used to it that its almost more 
difficult for them to try a long distance relationship, because its that 
much more difficult. 

but as long as you have a goal in sight its all worth it. For me its 10 
more months. 10 more months and itll be over (the long distance part), and 
then 1-2 years later: marriage. I cant fucking wait =)﻿
comments.author: metroid2

comments.text:
Shitty video about LDR. "Depressed" people talking about it? Not of so much 
help. ﻿
comments.author: Delisha Meraz

comments.text:
I'm currently in a long distance relationship with my boyfriend who I met 
while I was teaching in China. He's Chinese so we also have to deal with 
the cross cultural aspect of our relationship. The distance and time 
difference makes it really hard. We can't speak often, in fact we haven't 
been able to speak in over a month, but every time I ask myself if it's 
worth it, I realize that there is no other possible answer than yes. For 
me, all the pain and loneliness and general suckiness of a long distance 
relationship will be worth it once I see him again. Who knows when that 
will be.﻿
comments.author: Evelyn Ewald

comments.text: so hard :(﻿
comments.author: Multi Vid

comments.text:
Personally, I couldn't be in a Long distance relationship unless I've met 
the guy in person, known him long enough in person to know that he's worth 
all the emotional pain. Kudos to you guys who do though! I hope it works 
out :).﻿
comments.author: Stephanie Nnadi

comments.text:
My boyfriend lives in England 9 hour DIFFRENCe means I only get to talk to 
him when U wake up to say "how was school" cause he gets OUTA school then 
when I get back talk to him for a bit and say "good night" I must admit it 
was hard but I gotten use to the fact and had fun with it talking about 
pranks we did at school and all the only time we get to talk talk in voice 
is on Saturday and Sunday's I haven't been able to go out like I wanted to 
and if I stay after school I won't get those 30 mins to talk to him and it 
really means a lot to me cause I would un OUTA school to get home and laugh 
and talk to him he's my best friend and my boyfriend people costantly say 
"he's cheating on U" "wow that's sad" "PFT he's UR pen pal" what's sad is 
that U don't get what love is love is many things U can't just say it's 
dumb when U never even experienced it U no it is hard but I said I love U 
for a reason to him to fight to protect him and to never listen to those 
words out of my friends mouths and to always be loyal to him cause that's 
what holds me together now him talking to him makes me feel good that many 
people that hate me back stab me treat me like dirt it all doesn't matter 
cause in the end im the winner and ima take my ribbon (my boyfriend) and 
show the world HEY IM IN A LONG DISTANCE RELATIONSHIP AND IM PROUD TO BE 
DIFFERENT IF U DONT UNDERSTAND THEN SEARCH UP THE WORD LOVE MEANS A CLOSE 
BOND NOT A CLOSE DICK TO UR MOUTH high school kids having sex and making 
out does not make a relationship what makes a relationship is the hope the 
fight and the will power to protect them no matter what the world says ima 
smile and say "he's the kindest person I've ever known no one compares to 
him ..I love him"..﻿
comments.author: Stella Bella

comments.text:
The girl in pink that said "it's hard" and giggled right after that, well I 
saw the hurt in her eyes, and girl, I know how you feel. We've been there. 
Waiting for the other person to call you but you've to wait those heart 
wrenching days, I know. Those of us who have been in LDR know very well how 
that feels. ﻿
comments.author: syafikabashaa97

comments.text:
I'm currently in a long distant relationship and the love grows as if you 
really know the person﻿
comments.author: Melanie Garcia

comments.text:
Im in a LDR my so is in the navy we never talk but we keep in touch he has 
been gone for a year he comes home in june #navystrong ﻿
comments.author: Brandi Mignucci

comments.text:
Garrett can communicate so well with words and without his face. I felt it, 
bad.﻿
comments.author: Husna M

comments.text: I will never do this again in my life... it sucks﻿
comments.author: Fernando Rodriguez

comments.text:
From someone who has been in a stable long distance relationship for almost 
two years (total relationship length 2.5 years): you couldn't find one 
successful couple who was long distance for more than a year? really? maybe 
relationships like mine are few and far between, but I can't understand why 
all the examples in your video are of people who struggled with long 
distance relationships.﻿
comments.author: Christina Marinello

comments.text:
Im in a long distance relationship, and its nice to know that there are 
others in my boat. It sucks whem people always say "is that even worth it? 
Cant you find someone thats just closeby" and 

Ive been with this guy for almost a yr and a half we've seen each other 
twice, im in the us his in ireland.

Lately its been so hard cause it seems like were both on the verge of just 
giving up, but we dont want to. We know we can work it out,

But

Its hard.﻿
comments.author: xtine manuel

comments.text:
I've been in a long distance relationship for over a year now. We'll 
finally be together this summer! It's tough, but as the video description 
says, "When you really love someone, it makes it worth it." Also, when I 
say long distance, I really do mean LONG distance! I live in the United 
States, he lives in the United Kingdom. Just goes to show that it really is 
possible to overcome the distance!﻿
comments.author: Brianna Marie

comments.text: $5 says the 'good potatoes' are California Chicken Cafe's hot potatoes﻿
comments.author: bibblybubs

comments.text:
For me, the worst part is that no one else respects it or considers it a 
real relationship.﻿
comments.author: John Cisney

comments.text:
Watched this right after the what makes men cry video, because of Kieth, 
and I just feel so happy for him and his girlfriend for being able to live 
together.﻿
comments.author: jocybridget

comments.text: Keith and his girlfriend awwww <3﻿
comments.author: Katie Doman

comments.text:
I met my boyfriend through YouTube, it sounds crazy, right? Everyone took 
it as a joke and my parent's were skeptical at first, so after a few months 
from knowing each other, endless hours of Skyping, he came from the UK to 
the USA. To prove that he is real, he does love me, and that our 
relationship is meaningful. We've been together for 8 months now (9 soon!) 
and he's come by to see me twice. Now I'm going to the UK to see him next 
month!(: And I love him, I really do love him. We act the same, think the 
same, and enjoy each others company. There is never a dull moment with him. 
What helps is looking towards our future goals. We are saving up to live 
together, to go to the same uni, because we both really want this to 
happen. To make a long distance relationship work is to not lost that drive 
for each other. I love +RobsLife  - he is my favorite person on this planet 
and a blessing to me. (:﻿
comments.author: Kristin Schanks

comments.text:
What one of the guys said about silence really hit home with me. Cause 
silence when you're physically with someone, that says something about how 
comfortable you are with each other. Silence over the phone can't replicate 
that, it's always awkward.﻿
comments.author: Sara Nielsen

comments.text: Keith and his girlfriend are so cute!﻿
comments.author: Martina Kehyaian

comments.text:
My mom is in a long distance relationship from Vancouver, Canada to Perth, 
Australia ;-;﻿
comments.author: SkyBlu14

comments.text:
People put so much emphasis on all the bad things that can go wrong in a 
long distance relationship, but I agree with what one of the guys said that 
if you have an end goal in sight it is worth it. Been with my boyfriend for 
10 months currently, and he lives all the way in Texas, USA and myself 
being from Syd, Australia. We are hoping to close the distance in 2016, and 
with that in sight, it makes it worth it definitely, and besides I'll be 
seeing him for 3 months at the end of 2015, and that alone, regardless of 
the knowledge of when we may be able to close the distance, makes doing the 
distance 'worth it'.  I think people fail to see that two people even 
though far away, have a connection and love that they may not ever share 
with somebody else in their life, and when u meet that person for the first 
time, and u can feel that connection for the first time, that's when you'll 
know to keep going or maybe move on.﻿
comments.author: Menkcaz

comments.text:
i've been all the time in long distance relationships. 2 where from my 
country... which sucked... but i feel more happy with the 1 from another 
country. mine comes from Australia. and i will never give up. cuz they all 
broke up with me... 12 of them. and now i hope this relationship will last 
long.﻿
comments.author: Meandmaindog

comments.text:
I was in a long distance relationship for almost two years and it was the 
first time I felt actual feelings for someone. It was definitely a 
beautiful experience and even though we didn't get to meet I don't regret 
it. He taught me so many things about life and about love. I just now hope 
we maybe meet in a future coincidentally ﻿
comments.author: Cecilia G

comments.text:
So true...the worst is having nothing to say, and just wondering how the 
other person feels about it, and the relationship as a whole.﻿
comments.author: Maggie Clark

comments.text: U.S.,UK :(﻿
comments.author: Pvt Marquise Hollis

comments.text:
I met my husband on roosterteeth.com back in 2005. I got on the Internet at 
school to talk to him. I didn't have the Internet and had just got a phone. 
I could barely talk to him because I had 6 other people in my family on the 
phone. He lived about 90 miles away from me. He didn't have his license and 
neither did I. We started dating about a month later. He moved in with me 
when he graduated. And we've been together ever since. It will be 10 years 
in May. We've had so many ups and downs but I wouldn't trade it for 
anything. ﻿
comments.author: Cataluna Riokari

comments.text:
It can work if you two really love each other, I'm originally from Ukraine 
but live in Israel and my husband is from the US, we've been married for a 
year now and soon we'll be together﻿
comments.author: katie goodlett

comments.text:
2.5 years ago my boyfriend and I were long distance for about 8 months and 
for the last 10 month we also have been long distance. I's been really hard 
and I've felt lonely many times, but it has totally been worth it! We've 
been together for 9 years total, and are getting married in 45 days, which 
means that we will get to be "long distance husband and wife" for about 1 
month before he finally comes back home to me and we are done with the long 
distance thing for a long time! I'm so excited! :D﻿
comments.author: MsGadgaard

comments.text:
"This sucks that this is our relationship right now". That's my exact 
feeling everyday because my boyfriend is 700 miles away. It sucks, and it's 
really hard for some people. Even though it's worth it, I still wish I 
could just see the person every day and actually be in their presence. ﻿
comments.author: Vanessa Landaverde

comments.text: Awww Keith and his gf are just awwwww﻿
comments.author: Angela Gonzales

comments.text:
My parent been in long distance relationship for over 11 years, way before 
Skype was even exist. My dad will only come back home once a year and yes 
they are still happily together till now. I've been in long distance 
relationship for 3 years and will be for another 1 year with 8 hours time 
different and everyday is an interesting day for us. Communication and 
trust is all I got to say.﻿
comments.author: Zarifah

comments.text:
I am a little skeptical about the whole "dating" things until my college 
friend keeps her long distance relationship for four years and still 
counting. Love exist!﻿
comments.author: Half-Blind

comments.text:
I've been in a long distance relationship twice. 
The first one, it was only about 2 months. He was, sadly, cheating so we 
obviously broke up. 
the second one, he was amazing, a guy who would just could make you happy 
for the rest of your life. The best person ever. The sad part was, since 
the distance was too much for him, he dated another girl and stopped 
talking to me. I found out BC he had the date of his new girlfriend [now 
ex] on his Instagram bio. we still keep contact, we couldn't see each 
other. We always planned our life together. We're not together, sadly, but 
we love each other still. It's hard not seeing him, not knowing how he 
sounds like...nothing. I know a lot about him, we'll sorta. We talk 
everyday...we usually talk like any other couple would but it's sad not 
being able to do the things you want to do with that person. He lives in 
another country, which makes it even harder [i live in the U.S]. We want to 
meet, once we do, we'll be a couple once again. (:﻿
comments.author: Antonia Ladino

comments.text: 2 years...never ran out of things to say.﻿
comments.author: robert hoffman

comments.text:
I wish I could hug my boyfriend. I haven't met him in person because a 
friend introduced us. We might be able to meet in around four months and 
even then it's only a possibility. But it's worth it I love him so much. 
I'm only thirteen and you can go ahead and say all the stuff about me not 
knowing what love is yet but idc. I just felt like sharing my story so here 
ya go :D﻿
comments.author: Aoife Graham

comments.text:
My fiancee and I were in a long distance relationship from Canada to the UK 
for three years before moving in together and next week we're getting 
married!
it works if you want to make it work, simple﻿
comments.author: pamandemily

comments.text: my girl from UK :) am still thinking it can work out i love her﻿
comments.author: Pvt Marquise Hollis

comments.text:
I was in a long distance relationship for four years , was it worth it? 
yes, because I learned how to appreciate how to love someone and learned 
how to have patience. I don't understand how one them said that he 
couldn't stand the silence, or whatever he said, but I never had a silent 
moment, there was constant talking, all the time. Since you are not with 
your partner all day , I feel like it is easier to find something to talk 
about with each other about what happened throughout their days. Sadly, we 
are not together anymore because we never saw each as much as we wanted 
too. We are still very close though:)  ﻿
comments.author: les2729

comments.text:
I was in a long distance relationship for 4 years. Now we attend the same 
college and are getting married in June 2016. It was definitely difficult 
at times but we saw each other for a weekend about every 2-3 months which 
helped a lot. Frequent texting and calling helps considerably as well; I 
cannot imagine dating someone long distance before communication was so 
easy.﻿
comments.author: Keri Bishop

comments.text:
Hey try having your lover put in military school then having to wait 11 
months with no contact what so ever and being completely faithful the whole 
TIME!!!!!!﻿
comments.author: Komeo

comments.text:
I met this one girl on a cruise and we started dating the 3 day of the 
cruise and we've been Skyping and using Facebook and texting each other and 
were still going and its been 2 months now and were still together but on 
the cruise people said we wouldn't last but were still dating and I hope it 
last forever that we still date I just cant wait to see her again﻿
comments.author: Kayden Villarreal

comments.text:
Skype has truly changed the nature of LDRs. There's still another month 
until I see my love, and being able to catch him on Skype is difficult, as 
is - he's been 7 hours ahead for 4/5 of these months. But some things are 
worth waiting for...and Skype makes that wait a little more bearable.

Would I do it again? Well...yes and no. It has forced us to grow closer - 
to talk about things we never would have, if we could have seen each other 
every day all day. But it has also pushed me to my limits emotionally - 
taken me to emotional lows I thought I'd beaten years ago. In reality, that 
just tells me how very much he means to me...but I wouldn't want to visit 
depression again.

(It also took me to the most beautiful emotional high I've had, considering 
the heartfelt love letter I just wrote last night for our 7 month 
anniversary, after writing it in my head for like, a month now!)﻿
comments.author: angeldragon2010

comments.text:
My husband and I had a long distance relationship for 2 years. I was in the 
states. Hes in Canada. It was hard work but well worth it. Now we have been 
married since June 😊﻿
comments.author: Candace Schluter

comments.text: DEPRESSINGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGG﻿
comments.author: Stephanos Karavas

comments.text:
My boyfriend and I met on an online game and we have been dating for 2 
years. It's an international relationship. We skype everyday, every night, 
every moment possible we are together online. We see each other two times a 
year or so. It's still difficult not being able to see the one you love and 
care about face to face whenever you want, or not being able to hug one 
another when you're feeling down or sad. :(﻿
comments.author: Mari Nicole

comments.text:
Thank you so much for this video!! It feels so good to hear other stories 
from people who lived in a long distance relationship and GOT IT! :) Your 
videos are amazing! <3﻿
comments.author: Sun shine

comments.text: Hey Indian girl. Tell us about that  scar on your arm. ﻿
comments.author: Bidwat Raj Pokhrel

comments.text:
I was in a long distance relationship for almost 2 years before it ended. 
Funny how someone so far could make a huge impact on you. Since then, I 
stopped dating altogether. ﻿
comments.author: cheong aziela

comments.text:
Holy shit made it like a minute in and stopped. Depressing music didn't 
help.﻿
comments.author: UntiltheDawnFilm

comments.text:
I am currently in a long distance relationship, we've been dating for one 
year. Met as freshman, but he had to stay home after that year...and we 
live on opposite sides of the country. Right now I'm actually in Europe 
with a 9 hour time difference...and I will not say it's easy. There are 
days where I have no motivation, where I cry because he's not there to help 
me, motivate me, make me feel better. The first time I saw him after 
separating I actually cried for a long time in his arms as he held 
me...because I hadn't realized how much I'd missed him for those few 
months... However I do know that he loves me, and we try to Skype every 
night. I love him so much and that is the only thing keeping us together. 
We visit during the breaks, and we know that once we graduate, we will get 
married and finally be together like we used to be. Until that day, we'll 
have to bear the separation with the knowledge that it makes the reunion 
that much sweeter...<3﻿
comments.author: shadamyand sonamylover

comments.text:
Me and my ldr facetime all day everyday we never hang up on skype unless 
she's is at work we never go days with out facetime we facetimed once for 
like 46 hours with out hanging up and I see her in May so yay !:)﻿
comments.author: Lexiee Danielle

comments.text: FOLLOW ME ON TWITTER:@BIJAL_SHETH﻿
comments.author: Bijal Sheth

comments.text:
Yes. Long distance relationships are really hard. My boyfriend of three 
months lives all the way in England and I live in Ohio. It really sucks 
when I know that he's not sitting next to me. The time zone difference also 
makes it a little difficult to do anything (England is 5 hours ahead of 
eastern time) BUT he said when he becomes an adult he'll fly over here and 
live here. I think he might visit me before then but it's not fully 
established yet﻿
comments.author: Kay Invader

comments.text:
In order for your boyfriend to actually settle in usa he will need to have 
either dual nationality or a work visa and America only grants work visas 
to 'highly skilled workers' with degrees such as doctors etc.
The only other option is marriage where you will be his legally bound 
sponsor.
comments.author: Dim Wit

comments.text:
What It’s Like To Be In A Long Distance Relationship: 
https://youtu.be/uDJ2bj2Upqg﻿
comments.author: Arctic Blizzard

comments.text:
Im basically about to begin being in a log distance relationship with 
someone and im scared of how far away we are and will things die off before 
its even begun because of that :(﻿
comments.author: SkyRider 38

comments.text:
;-; In the other video, what makes men cry.... I forgot his name damnit.... 
well, the guy with the girlfriend, he wears glasses, and is bae... was he 
talking about her? the girl with him?? awe﻿
comments.author: DyanCat

comments.text:
+DyanCat you meant Keith? The guy who cried because he had to move to LA 
and his girlfriend lived in Chicago? If yes then that's him (:
comments.author: Van Nguyen

comments.text:
I was actually watching another couple´s videos before this one,I was 
already a little sad,but this one made me cry.I´m currently in a long 
distance relationship & is the hardest thing I´ve done to myself,the first 
comment was the one who brought my tears out because nobody gets it & you 
don´t actually get much support,you have more negative chats,nobody thinks 
it will actually work,so its pretty sad.And in the intern side,you do have 
that little voice in your head of this is just a dream & maybe your 
"friends" are right& if you´re the one putting the most effort in it,is the 
worst feeling ever,I don´t really recommend anyone to be in this kind of 
relationship,even if everything is fine,you´ll be heartbroken cause you 
can´t be with the one you love. :(﻿
comments.author: Ash Gonzales

comments.text: I'm with guy in the red shirt﻿
comments.author: David James

comments.text: i can relate to these people. except the part about moving in.﻿
comments.author: Fluffy288

comments.text:
2 years in a long distance relationship and let me tell you something. When 
you finally get to go up to meet her and you step off of the train and see 
her sitting there a fee feet away from you on that bench glowing in the 
evening sun and it hits you that even being just this close to her is far, 
far greater than any of the wonderful times you've had with her on skype 
that's when you know that those long months you've both had with an aching 
heart were all worth it if only for that moment. That's when you know that 
everything is going to be better than you ever could have hoped. 

That was my experience three months ago and I can't wait to return to her 
for good in another two.﻿
comments.author: Silver Fang
